awd_abstract_narration:
This award provides funding for participation in the "Workshop in Analysis and Probability" to be held on the campus of Texas A&M University during the period June 15 to August 15, 2019, and during similar periods in the summers of 2020 and 2021. The Workshop brings together senior and junior researchers and advanced graduate students in analysis, probability, and related fields of mathematics in order to broaden participation and to promote interaction among researchers working in different areas. It sponsors Concentration Weeks and a yearly three-day conference entitled Summer Informal Regional Functional Analysis Seminar (SUMIRFAS).


In 2019, the three-day conference will be held July 26 to 28 and the Concentration Week "Randomness and Determinism in Compressive Data Acquisition" will take place July 22 to 26. In addition to advanced lectures for experts, Concentration Weeks include introductory lectures designed to acquaint junior researchers and non-experts with the basics of a topical area of current interest. The Workshop will provide support to many researchers not on sponsored research grants who will benefit from contact with established leaders in the field and from being in a research-friendly environment. Emphasis is placed on the support of early career researchers, members of underrepresented groups, and graduate students. More information about the Workshop can be found at <http://www.math.tamu.edu/~kerr/workshop>.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
The Workshop brought together senior and junior researchers and graduate students in several areas of analysis and probability, as well as some researchers in other fields, such as geometry and theoretical computer science with the goal of broadening the education of the younger participants and of promoting interaction among researchers in different areas. The Workshop featured Concentration Weeks on:

  • Randomness and Determinism in Compressive Data Acquisition (2019)
  • Bellman Function Methods on the Hamming Cube (2020, held online) 
  • Graduate Student Concentration Week on Metric Geometry (2022) 
  • Geometry and Analysis on Nonsmooth Spaces (2022),
  • Ideals and Algebras of Operators on Banach Spaces (2023)
  • Probability and Algebra: New Expressions (2023)

The Workshop also included several installments of the three-day conference SUMIRFAS (Summer Informal Regional Functional Analysis Seminar) (2019, 2021 (online), 2022, 2023) with a special 5-day edition in 2024. Every summer (but in 2020 and 2021 due to the pandemic), there were about ten individual seminar talks as part of the Workshop seminar series. 

The Concentration Weeks included introductory lectures designed to acquaint junior researchers and non-experts with the basics of a discipline as well as advanced lectures for experts. The Concentration Week "Randomness and Determinism in Compressive Data Acquisition" treated a spectrum of topics related to compressive sensing and data science at large, including pseudorandomness and derandomization, random matrices and high-dimensional probability, metric and linear geometry, semidefinite programming, convex geometry, and dimension reduction. The Concentration Week "Bellman Function Methods on the Hamming Cube" was primarily aimed at graduate students and postdocs and provided an introduction to the main tools, current results, and open problems in the study of functional inequalities on the Hamming cube. The Concentration Week "Geometry and Analysis on Nonsmooth Spaces" covered topics ranging from Poincare-type inequalities,  heat kernel methods, Dirichlet forms, and functional inequalities, to analysis in nonsmooth metric spaces and sub-Riemannian geometry. This concentration was preceded by a "Graduate Student Concentration Week on Metric Geometry" featuring lecture series by junior researchers (mostly holding postdoctoral positions) on similar topics and many contributed talks by Ph.D. students. The Concentration Week "Ideals and Algebras of Operators on Banach Spaces" brought together researchers interested in the various aspects of spaces of operators in Banach spaces. Particular emphasis was given to the rich theory induced by quotients over classical ideals as well as by the plenitude of different ideals by showcasing cutting-edge technologies in constructing and studying ideals in the algebras of bounded linear operators on classical and non-classical spaces, draw parallels to the study of C* and operator algebras, and set the tone for future research directions in the field. The Concentration Week "Probability and Algebra: New Expressions" served as a platform to display innovative connections between the fields of probability and algebra, in a very general sense. Some examples of these interactions can be found in integrable probability, free probability, combinatorics, and random matrix theory.  

The Workshop activities have had a broad impact by providing intellectual stimulation for all participants as well as giving an opportunity to a diverse group of graduate students and junior researchers to broaden their education across a wide range of topics in functional analysis and related fields (operator theory, probability theory, metric geometry, harmonic analysis, Banach spaces, operator algebras, free probability, approximation theory, and signal processing) and through a variety of formats, from the lectures series and research talks in the Concentration Weeks to the individual seminars where participants presented and discussed their work in a less formal setting.
